Domain acquired on Hostinger and site deployment on Vercel for high availability and performance.

post1.title: React Best Practices in 2024
post1.excerpt: Discover the best practices and modern patterns for building scalable and maintainable React applications.
post1.content:
React has evolved significantly in recent years. In this article we explore current best practices for developing modern applications with React.

1. Use Hooks Effectively
Hooks have revolutionized the way we write React components. useState and useEffect are fundamental, but hooks like useMemo and useCallback can significantly optimize performance.

2. Small and Focused Components
Keep your components small and with a single responsibility. This makes your code easier to test and maintain.

3. TypeScript for Greater Safety
TypeScript helps you catch errors at development time and makes your code more robust.

4. Server Components with Next.js
React Server Components allow rendering components on the server, significantly improving performance.

post2.title: Next.js Performance Optimization
post2.excerpt: Learn to optimize the performance of your Next.js applications with advanced loading and rendering techniques.
post2.content:
Next.js offers multiple tools to optimize the performance of your web applications. Here are the most effective techniques.

1. Image Optimization
Use the next/image component for automatic image optimization. It supports lazy loading, modern formats like WebP, and responsive images.

2. Intelligent Code Splitting
Next.js automatically splits your code, but you can optimize it further using dynamic imports for heavy components.

3. Server-Side Rendering and Static Generation
Choose the right strategy: SSR for dynamic content, SSG for static content, and ISR for the best of both worlds.

4. Caching and Revalidation
Implement intelligent caching strategies using HTTP headers and Next.js revalidation API.

post3.title: TypeScript Tips and Tricks
post3.excerpt: Practical tips to make the most of TypeScript in your web development projects.
post3.content:
TypeScript has become the standard for professional JavaScript projects. Here are some tips for using it effectively.

1. Generic Types
Generic types allow you to create reusable components and functions with complete type safety.

2. Utility Types
TypeScript includes utility types like Partial, Pick, Omit, and Record that simplify type manipulation.

3. Type Guards
Use type guards to refine types at runtime and improve TypeScript's inference.

4. Strict Configuration
Enable strict mode in tsconfig.json to catch more potential errors.

5. Interfaces vs Types
When to use interfaces and when to use types. Generally, interfaces for objects that can be extended, types for unions and intersections.
